exercises.title: Identifying Conversational Implicature
exercises.instructions: Read each conversation and identify what the speaker really means (the implied meaning).

questions.question:
A: გიბიძგებთ ჩემთან ჩასვლა ხვალ საღამოს?
B: შეიძლება, მგონია, მე უნდა ვიმუშაო...

What does B really mean?
questions.questionGeorgian: A: გიბიძგებთ ჩემთან ჩასვლა ხვალ საღამოს? B: შეიძლება, მგონია, მე უნდა ვიმუშაო...

options.text: B will definitely work tomorrow evening
B is politely declining the invitation
B needs to confirm their work schedule
B will come after finishing work

questions.explanation: The hedging words 'შეიძლება' (maybe) and 'მგონია' (I think) combined with mentioning work obligations is a typical Georgian way of politely declining without directly saying 'no'.

questions.question:
A: როგორ გაქვს ბიზნესი?
B: კარგად წავედით, ალბათ აღარაფერი...

What is the implied meaning of B's response?
questions.questionGeorgian: A: როგორ გაქვს ბიზნესი? B: კარგად წავედით, ალბათ აღარაფერი...

options.text: The business is doing very well
The business is struggling despite positive framing
B is uncertain about the business status

questions.explanation: Despite saying 'კარგად წავედით' (we went well), the phrase 'ალბათ აღარაფერი' (probably nothing) suggests underlying problems. This is a Georgian way of signaling difficulties indirectly.

questions.question:
Mother: არ მოვიდე ეს თით ხეებზე?

What is the mother really asking?
questions.questionGeorgian: დედა: არ მოვიდე ეს თით ხეებზე?

options.text: A literal question about a finger and trees
An indirect request to help with gardening

questions.explanation: This is a Georgian idiom. The literal translation is about a finger coming to trees, but it pragmatically means 'to help clean/garden.' This is an indirect speech act - a request disguised as a question.

questions.question:
Speaker: ფაქტია, ახლა ბევრად ცივია ბინა.

What is the speaker really doing?
questions.questionGeorgian: ხოლმე: ფაქტია, ახლა ბევრად ცივია ბინა.

options.text: Simply stating a fact about temperature
Indirectly requesting someone to turn up the heat

questions.explanation: While literally noting the temperature, this statement pragmatically functions as an indirect request to increase heating. The phrase 'ფაქტია' signals this is an observation requiring action.

questions.question: Which pragmatic marker often signals disbelief or ironic stance?
questions.explanation: 'ვითომ' (vitom) means 'as if / supposedly' and is used to signal disbelief, skepticism, or an ironic stance. It's a key pragmatic marker for expressing non-literal meanings.

exercises.title: Context-Dependent Interpretation
exercises.instructions: Fill in the blanks with the most appropriate pragmatic phrase based on context.

questions.question:
Professional context: აუცილებელია _____ წარმოადგინოთ საბუთები.
(Politely but firmly: necessary to present documents)
questions.explanation: In professional contexts, 'აუცილებელია' (it's necessary) creates a formal directive tone. The phrase is assertive but not overly demanding.

questions.question:
Polite refusal context: _____ _____ _____, ვერ ვისარგებლებ შემოთავაზებით.
(Indirect refusal: 'Not excluded' form)
questions.explanation: 'არ არის გამორიცხული' (it's not excluded) creates diplomatic hedging. It suggests possibility while often pragmatically conveying unlikelihood.

questions.question:
Hedging context: _____ ეს მიდგომა უფრო ეფექტურია.
('I think' - showing intellectual humility)
questions.explanation: 'მგონია' (I think/It seems to me) is the most common hedge in Georgian, signaling intellectual humility and allowing for nuance in debate.

exercises.title: Match Pragmatic Markers to Their Functions
exercises.instructions: Match each Georgian pragmatic marker with its primary communicative function.

questions.explanation: Understanding pragmatic markers allows you to decode subtle communicative intent. These particles and expressions modify meaning beyond literal interpretation.

exercises.title: Reading Hierarchical Subtext
exercises.instructions: Analyze how relationship dynamics affect meaning in these utterances.

questions.question:
ბატონო დავით, თქვენ ახლობლები ხართ?
vs.
დათი, ახლობლები ხარ?

What does the use of 'ბატონო' vs. first name imply?
questions.questionGeorgian: A: ბატონო დავით, თქვენ ახლობლები ხართ? B: დათი, ახლობლები ხარ?

options.text: The first shows formal respect and professional distance; the second shows close friendship

questions.explanation: 'ბატონო' (sir) creates formal hierarchy and suggests professional or distant relationship. First name alone implies familiarity, friendship, and equal status. In Georgian culture, address forms carry heavy pragmatic meaning.

questions.question: At a supra (traditional feast), the tamada says: 'დურმა, ქალბატონო...' What does this imply?

options.text: A toast is directed specifically at you

questions.explanation: At a supra, addressing someone with 'ქალბატონო' (madam) during a toast is a direct pragmatic act. It requires drinking, acknowledging the toast, and potentially responding. Georgian supra rituals are heavily pragmatic.

questions.question:
Speaker 1: როგორ ხარ?
Speaker 2: სწორად დაი

What is the pragmatic function of 'სწორად დაი'?
questions.questionGeorgian: A: როგორ ხარ? B: სწორად დაი

options.text: A literal description of going straight

questions.explanation: 'სწორად დაი' literally means 'go straight' but pragmatically functions as an emphatic 'absolutely yes' idiom. It's a cultural expression that cannot be understood literally.

exercises.title: Understanding Register and Tone
exercises.instructions: Select the most appropriate pragmatic interpretation based on context.

questions.question:
Professional context: 'აუცილებელია ცვლილება.'
Family context: 'შეიძლება, ცვლილება არ გამოუვიდეს?'

What's the pragmatic difference?
questions.questionGeorgian: პროფესიონალური: აუცილებელია ცვლილება. ოჯახური: შეიძლება, ცვლილება არ გამოუვიდეს?

options.text: The first is softer, the second is more demanding
The first is a firm directive; the second is a very soft, indirect suggestion
They mean exactly the same thing
The first is a question, the second is a statement

questions.explanation: Context dramatically changes pragmatic meaning. 'აუცილებელია' (it's necessary) is assertive in professional settings. 'შეიძლება არ გამოუვიდეს?' (couldn't it work out?) is extremely indirect family talk, avoiding confrontation.

questions.question: Which phrase signals the strongest hedging/uncertainty?
questions.explanation: 'შეიძლება' (perhaps/maybe) carries the softest uncertainty and is often used for polite refusals or hesitant agreement. It creates maximum flexibility in interpretation.
